definition: (of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially

sentences.english: Removing her skirt, she then asked Gessen to do another picture on the back of her petticoat.
sentences.chinese: 说着她脱下衬裙，让月仙在里子那一面再画一幅。

sentences.english: She took off the smock and stood there in a bright green slip.
sentences.chinese: 她脱下工作服，穿上一件鲜绿色调的衬裙站在那里。

sentences.english: and you know, Petticoat Lane is very English market here.
sentences.chinese: 另外，衬裙巷是一个非常英国式的集市。

sentences.english: My underskirt had ridden up into a thick band around my hips.
sentences.chinese: 我的衬裙已经蹿到臀部，厚厚地卷成一圈。

sentences.english: A dozen petticoats bulked out her figure.
sentences.chinese: 十几条衬裙把她的身体撑得圆鼓鼓的。

sentences.english: Teacher is to wear at least two petticoats.
sentences.chinese: 老师必须要穿至少两件衬裙。

sentences.english: As she lifted her petticoat easy and slow.
sentences.chinese: 她从容而缓慢的提起衬裙。

sentences.english: It was like living inside a petticoat.
sentences.chinese: 我们就像住在衬裙里面。

sentences.english: I could just see her petticoat peeking out from under her skirt.
sentences.chinese: 我能看到她的衬裙从裙子下露了出来。

sentences.english: To wear at least two petticoats.
Women's or girls' half-slip, of textile materials, not knitted or crocheted.
sentences.chinese: 女式或女童半身衬裙，纺织材料制，非针织或钩编。

sentences.english: After all, what would be more proper to wear with Petticoat breeches, than high-heeled shoes?
sentences.chinese: 不过，还有什么能比高跟鞋更配带衬裙的短裤呢？

sentences.english: She stood there, in her red petticoat, with a smile on her face.
sentences.chinese: 她站在那里，穿着红色的衬裙，脸上带着微笑。

sentences.english: A petticoat made of this fabric.
sentences.chinese: 用这种织物做成的衬裙。

definition: old feminine garment, covering chest and abdomen
